t: Psalm 22
A Cry of Anguish and a Song of Praise.
For the choir director; upon Aijeleth Hashshahar. A Psalm of David.
My*pn God, my God, why have You forsaken me? Far*ln from my deliverance are the words of my groaning.
O*ln my God, I cry by day, but You do not answer; And*ln by night, but I have no rest.
Yet*ln You are holy, O*ln You who are enthroned upon the praises of Israel.
In*ln You our fathers trusted; They*ln trusted and You delivered them.
To*ln You they cried out and were delivered; In*ln You they trusted and were not disappointed.
But*ln I am a worm and not a man, A*ln reproach of men and despised by the people.
All*ln who see me sneer at me; They*ln separate with the lip, they wag the head, saying,*i
“Commit*ln yourself*i to the Lord;*s let Him deliver him; Let*ln Him rescue him, because He delights in him.”
Yet*ln You are He who brought me forth from the womb; You*ln made me trust when*i upon my mother’s breasts.
Upon*ln You I was cast from birth; You*ln have been my God from my mother’s womb.
Be*ln not far from me, for trouble is near; For*ln there is none to help.
Many*ln bulls have surrounded me; Strong*ln bulls*i of Bashan have encircled me.
They*ln open wide their mouth at me, As*ln a ravening and a roaring lion.
I*ln am poured out like water, And*ln all my bones are out of joint; My*ln heart is like wax; It*ln is melted within me.
My*ln strength is dried up like a potsherd, And*ln my tongue cleaves to my jaws; And*ln You lay me in the dust of death.
For*ln dogs have surrounded me; A*ln band of evildoers has encompassed me; They*ln pierced my hands and my feet.
I*ln can count all my bones. They*ln look, they stare at me;
They*ln divide my garments among them, And*ln for my clothing they cast lots.
But*ln You, O Lord,*s be not far off; O*ln You my help, hasten to my assistance.
Deliver*ln my soul from the sword, My*ln only life*i from the power of the dog.
Save*ln me from the lion’s mouth; From*ln the horns of the wild oxen You answer me.
I*ln will tell of Your name to my brethren; In*ln the midst of the assembly I will praise You.
You*ln who fear the Lord,*s praise Him; All*ln you descendants of Jacob, glorify Him, And*ln stand in awe of Him, all you descendants of Israel.
For*ln He has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; Nor*ln has He hidden His face from him; But*ln when he cried to Him for help, He heard.
From*ln You comes*i my praise in the great assembly; I*ln shall pay my vows before those who fear Him.
The*ln afflicted will eat and be satisfied; Those*ln who seek Him will praise the Lord.*s Let*ln your heart live forever!
All*ln the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the Lord,*s And*ln all the families of the nations will worship before You.
For*ln the kingdom is the Lord’s*s And*ln He rules over the nations.
All*ln the prosperous of the earth will eat and worship, All*ln those who go down to the dust will bow before Him, Even*ln he who cannot keep his soul alive.
Posterity*ln will serve Him; It*ln will be told of the Lord to the coming*i generation.
They*ln will come and will declare His righteousness To*ln a people who will be born, that He has performed it.*i
